title: Permabanned with no warning is that a thing?
body: I have been playing League for a bout a year-ish and most of that time I was playing in like 2 week chunks. I have never gotten chat banned (though my friend has on his account). Never have been temp banned or anything like that (though I play with friends who have) and I come to log in today after not playing for a week and I am perma-banned :( It's a bummer considering the money I foolishly spent on the game.... I never got an E-mail as the log in says I should have received but I have submitted a ticket to try and figure out whats going on. You all have seen posts like this from various people over the past few months as I have been reading them, but I assure you that I am absolutely confused and wanted some input to see if its actually possible to not get a warning then be banned :/ Everyone who has ever played the game has gotten angry for some reason or another so don't hit me with those cliches... I am looking for someone who is educated on the topic to give me a hint on how to find out exactly what I got banned for, not just a page that tells me everything I could be banned for. To be banned with no warning that I was breaking the Summoners Code, is a little ridiculous... Does anyone else think so?

The usage of the word **as** an insult (especially this common) is exactly what is the problem.
As an analogy: Imagine people started using "Proxvir" as an insult. And that's not just a coincidence, the use of the insult directly tracks back to people disliking you for being Proxvir. The people using it today are also mostly aware of this connection, or at the very least are perfectly aware that it's your name. They knowingly and specifically use **your** name to describe everything they consider bad.
How would you feel about that?

I'd say that would be a pretty Proxvir situation for you to be in.
Hate speech can be used as a common insult and still be hate speech.

The current behavior system almost trolls people into thinking stuff like "gg ez, " report x player" and the usual ripping and flaming teammates is okay, because people aren't punished quickly enough for it. Yeah, they might after so many games if they keep it up and people actually report them, but this doesn't always happen.

The last two punishments I took, I heard these three phrases and as far as I know no one was punished for them:

> REPORT GREAT MUTA

> ASSHAT

> SUCK MY DICK

If you want to punish me fine, but when teammates are saying the same thing and nothing happens, it makes the system look like a complete joke and makes people like me think "this system is out to get me" and "They used that language and didn't get punished, so it's okay".

What makes you think that those players weren't punished for their misbehaviour?  Just like other players who you have verbally abused don't get notifications about actions taken on your account there is no reason you would know when they get punished too.

No notification, as simple as that. And if you are reporting people and the game is punishing them and not sending notifications, then the notification system is broken.

And if they aren't being punished? People like myself think the system doesn't care  and don't see a reason to care either.

Also, do you know how many people I've reported this week? Easily 20+ people. That's a lot of punishments and the game would have no one left to play if all of them are punished.

We also have to question whether majority of players is reporting to stop a behavior or to use the reporting system as a way to get revenge. Because when I see full teams ask to report someone while calling them names, that's more of a revenge thing.

The support is not 100% automated. I've had to go there a lot and gotten real messages from various people.

To the best of my knowledge, none of the support is automated (with a few exceptions like Blitzbot that handles the free skin distribution [though I don't know if it still does] which has no interaction with any behaviour tickets), but they have a lot of tickets to get through, so if it's a question they get a lot they will often use a macro response to reduce queue times for everyone else. More often than not the macro responses do in fact answer the question, but because they are what they are they tend to leave people rather unsatisfied/feeling like support hasn't listened.

This is especially true for those who do not understand their punishments, but such is the purpose of the PB board and the arbiters. If they feel a specific behaviour should not be ban worthy then if they bring it to boards they can get a good feel for the community view of said behaviour. 

Being people, support will sometimes misread or misunderstand something (especially given the diversity of people they interact with and the difficulty in conveying tone through text) but for the most part every ticket is read and understood, and if a macro response addresses the concern then that is what they will use.
